title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0088

segments.en: Hello, English learners.
Welcome back to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
And I'm Erika.
And today we're looking at some more romance.
segments.cn: 今天我们要讨论一些浪漫的内容。

segments.en: We're talking about dating.
Dating, exactly.
And not only dating, but asking someone to become your boyfriend or girlfriend.
segments.cn: 不仅是约会，还有邀请某人成为你的男朋友或女朋友。

segments.en: Yep, that's true.
And so we're going to be focusing on language to express your romantic feelings.
segments.cn: 所以我们将专注于表达浪漫情感的语言。

segments.en: And also maybe some phrases you can use to ask someone out.
segments.cn: 也许还有一些你可以用来邀请别人约会的短语。

segments.en: Very good.
So I'm sure you guys are excited about this one.
segments.cn: 我相信你们对此感到兴奋。

segments.en: So let's listen to the dialogue for the first time.
segments.cn: 那么我们先听一次对话。

segments.en: Hey, you're early.
Where is everyone?
Well, I told them not to come.
I made a reservation just for the two of us.
segments.cn: 我只为我们两个人预定了座位。

segments.en: I thought we could have a quiet evening all to ourselves.
segments.cn: 我想我们可以享受一个安静的晚上。

segments.en: Oh, why?
Jennifer, there's something I want to ask you.
Sure.
What is it?
Okay, here's the thing.
I've always seen you as more than just a friend.
segments.cn: 我一直把你视为不仅仅是朋友。

segments.en: And I can't take it anymore.
I know you better than anyone.
I know the pros and cons of your personality.
segments.cn: 我知道你性格的优缺点。

segments.en: I even know what side of the bed is yours.
segments.cn: 我甚至知道你床上的哪一边是你的。

segments.en: I think we would be great together, don't you?
segments.cn: 我觉得我们会很合适，你觉得呢？

segments.en: Are you serious?
We've been friends for years.
segments.cn: 我们已经是多年的朋友了。

segments.en: We can't just change that overnight.
segments.cn: 我们不能一夜之间就改变这一切。

segments.en: I know.
I never had the guts to tell you until today.
segments.cn: 我从来没有勇气告诉你，直到今天。

segments.en: So what do you say?
Are you willing to give me a shot?
segments.cn: 你愿意给我一个机会吗？

segments.en: Alright,
I wonder, is she going to say yes?
I don't know.
She seems a little bit confused.
Well, I guess it's always strange when your best friend suddenly wants to be your boyfriend or girlfriend.
segments.cn: 嗯，我想当你最好的朋友突然想成为你的男朋友或女朋友时，总是会感到奇怪。

segments.en: It does happen though.
It does happen.
So why don't we take a look at some of the vocabulary that was used in this dialogue to express these feelings.
segments.cn: 那么我们来看看在这段对话中用来表达这些情感的一些词汇。

segments.en: And let's start with Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 让我们从流利表达开始。

segments.en: Okay, so we're doing things a little differently today.
segments.cn: 好吧，今天我们有点不同。

segments.en: We're looking at phrases and not just vocabulary words.
segments.cn: 我们在看短语，而不仅仅是词汇。

segments.en: So he used some wonderful phrases to ask her to be his boyfriend.
segments.cn: 他用了一些很好的短语来邀请她成为他的女朋友。

segments.en: And he started with this.
Here's the thing.
Here's the thing.
Here's the phrase.
Here's the thing.
Is he giving her something?
Not quite.
He's not giving her an object, but he's giving her some information.
segments.cn: 他不是在给她一个物体，而是在给她一些信息。

segments.en: Okay, so it's a very common way to start an idea.
segments.cn: 好吧，这是一种很常见的开始表达想法的方式。

segments.en: That's right.
You're about to tell the person the main problem or the main... The main piece of information.
segments.cn: 你即将告诉对方主要问题或主要信息。

segments.en: Right, so you would start with, here's the thing, and then start explaining.
segments.cn: 对，所以你会以“事情是这样的”开始，然后开始解释。

segments.en: Okay, why don't we do an example?
segments.cn: 好吧，我们来做个例子吧？

segments.en: For example, you could say, alright, here's the thing.
segments.cn: 例如，你可以说，好吧，事情是这样的。

segments.en: People don't like you.
Alright, well I hope they don't say that to me.
segments.cn: 好吧，我希望他们不要对我这么说。

segments.en: But another example.
Marco, here's the thing.
We're behind in our podcasting.
We have to work overtime.
Okay, so the main idea.
Yep.
Very good.
Moving on to our next phrase.
segments.cn: 接下来是我们的下一个短语。

segments.en: He said, I can't take it.
I can't take it anymore.
I can't take it anymore.
So he can't take it anymore.
Take what?
Well, why don't we find out by listening to some examples.
segments.cn: 好吧，为什么我们不通过听一些例子来找出答案。

segments.en: Example one.
The man next door has been so loud.
I can't take it anymore.
Example two.
My boss always yells at me.
segments.cn: 我的老板总是对我大喊大叫。

segments.en: I can't take it anymore.
Example three.
I can't take it anymore.
I'm going to quit.
Alright, so basically is you can't stand it.
segments.cn: 好吧，基本上就是你无法忍受。

segments.en: You can't tolerate it anymore.
Exactly.
This is a phrase we use when we are really frustrated.
segments.cn: 这是我们在感到非常沮丧时使用的短语。

segments.en: Yeah, when we're frustrated or when we just can't handle it anymore.
segments.cn: 是的，当我们感到沮丧或无法再忍受时。

segments.en: And well, after he finished his declaration of love, she responded by saying, are you serious?
segments.cn: 而且，在他完成表白后，她回应说，你是认真的吗？

segments.en: Are you serious?
Are you serious?
Are you serious?
Okay, so what does she mean?
She's just saying really?
Exactly.
It's another way of saying really?
segments.cn: 这就是另一种说法，真的？

segments.en: Yep.
So this is a phrase that's really, it's quite informal, isn't it?
segments.cn: 所以这是一个非常非正式的短语，是吗？

segments.en: Yeah, I guess you wouldn't use it in a business context.
segments.cn: 是的，我想你不会在商业场合使用它。

segments.en: No, and it's also something that's used mostly by younger people.
segments.cn: 不，而且这也是大多数年轻人使用的表达。

segments.en: Right, if you say something that's amazing or that's incredible, hard to believe, you might get this response.
segments.cn: 对，如果你说某事很惊人或难以置信，你可能会得到这样的回应。

segments.en: Are you serious?
Right, so he is very serious but he confessed that he never had the guts to tell her.
segments.cn: 对，所以他非常认真，但他承认他从未有勇气告诉她。

segments.en: Mm-hmm, have the guts.
I never had the guts to tell you.
I never had the guts.
Alright, so to have guts.
That's to be brave.
To be brave, courageous.
Yep.
So we have some examples of how we would use guts in different situations, so let's listen.
segments.cn: 所以我们有一些例子，展示如何在不同情况下使用勇气，来听听。

segments.en: Example one.
I don't have the guts to go skydiving.
Example two.
I don't have the guts to give a speech.
Example three.
I've never had the guts to say no to my boss.
segments.cn: 我从未有勇气对我的老板说不。

segments.en: Alright, so to have the guts to do something.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以有勇气去做某事。

segments.en: Hey, but Marco, this word guts, it's an interesting one.
segments.cn: 嘿，但马尔科，这个词勇气，真有趣。

segments.en: Yes it is because guts can also mean your internal organs.
segments.cn: 是的，因为勇气也可以指你的内脏。

segments.en: Like your stomach and your intestines and your lungs.
Exactly, those are your guts.
segments.cn: 正是，这些就是你的勇气。

segments.en: Yep, so when you have guts, you're really brave.
segments.cn: 是的，所以当你有勇气时，你真的很勇敢。

segments.en: Exactly, you're courageous.
Mm-hmm.
Alright, very good.
Why don't we listen to the dialogue for the second time.
We're gonna slow it down a little bit and we'll come back and look at some phrases in putting it together.
segments.cn: 我们会稍微放慢速度，然后再回来看看一些短语如何结合在一起。

segments.en: Hey, you're early.
Where's everyone?
Well, I told them not to come.
I made a reservation just for the two of us.
segments.cn: 我只为我们两个人预定了座位。

segments.en: I thought we could have a quiet evening all to ourselves.
segments.cn: 我想我们可以有一个安静的晚上，只有我们自己。

segments.en: Oh, why?
Jennifer, there's something I want to ask you.
segments.cn: 珍妮弗，我有件事想问你。

segments.en: Sure, what is it?
Mmm, okay.
Here's the thing.
I've always seen you as more than just a friend and I can't take it anymore.
segments.cn: 我一直把你视为不仅仅是朋友，我再也忍受不了了。

segments.en: I know you better than anyone.
I know the pros and cons of your personality.
segments.cn: 我知道你性格的优缺点。

segments.en: I even know what side of the bed is yours.
segments.cn: 我甚至知道你床的哪一边是你的。

segments.en: I think we would be great together, don't you?
segments.cn: 我觉得我们会很合适，你觉得呢？

segments.en: Are you serious?
We've been friends for years.
segments.cn: 我们已经做朋友好多年了。

segments.en: We can't just change that overnight.
segments.cn: 我们不能就这样一夜之间改变。

segments.en: I are you willing to give me a shot?
segments.cn: 你愿意给我一个机会吗？

segments.en: Aye, aye.
All right, that's a little bit clearer this time, but while I was listening I noticed that there's some more great phrases that you can use together with different words.
segments.cn: 好吧，这次稍微清楚一点，但在我听的时候，我注意到还有一些很好的短语可以和不同的词一起使用。

segments.en: So let's look at those now in putting it together.
segments.cn: 所以现在让我们看看这些短语如何结合在一起。

segments.en: Putting it together.
All right, let's take a look at the first one.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们看看第一个。

segments.en: He said I made a reservation just for the two of us.
segments.cn: 他说我只为我们两个人预定了座位。

segments.en: The two of us?
Just the two of us.
So just the two of us.
Quite simply it means you and me.
Just us, right?
Right.
Just us.
So why is this phrase important?
segments.cn: 那么这个短语为什么重要？

segments.en: I think it's a great way to show the idea of only us, right?
segments.cn: 我认为这是一个很好的方式来表达只有我们，对吧？

segments.en: Right.
And we can use it together with any number we want.
segments.cn: 我们可以和任何数字一起使用。

segments.en: So what about the four of us?
Mm-hmm.
Just the four of us.
Okay.
Just the eight of us.
Okay.
So it suggests the idea of only us.
segments.cn: 所以它暗示了只有我们的想法。

segments.en: So he made the reservation just for the two of us because he thought they could have a quiet evening all to ourselves.
segments.cn: 所以他只为我们两个人预定了座位，因为他认为他们可以有一个安静的晚上，只有我们自己。

segments.en: All to ourselves.
All to ourselves.
All to ourselves.
If you have something all to yourself or we have something all to ourselves.
segments.cn: 如果你有某样东西完全属于你，或者我们有某样东西完全属于我们。

segments.en: We have that thing all alone.
segments.cn: 我们独自拥有那样东西。

segments.en: We don't have to share it.
We don't share.
Very good.
So I guess you can say my parents are out of town so I have the apartment.
segments.cn: 所以我想你可以说我父母不在城里，所以我有公寓。

segments.en: I have the house all to myself.
Mm-hmm.
Or even she wants to eat the cake all to herself.
segments.cn: 或者她甚至想把蛋糕完全留给自己。

segments.en: Very good.
So that's a very good phrase.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个非常好的短语。

segments.en: And you can use it with any pronoun.
Well, so the guy is explaining that I've always seen you as more than just a friend.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以这个家伙在解释我一直把你视为不仅仅是朋友。

segments.en: I've always seen you as.
I've always seen you as.
So basically is the perception or the way you consider that person.
segments.cn: 所以基本上是对那个人的看法或你对他的看法。

segments.en: The way you think about that person.
So I can say I've always seen you as a good friend.
segments.cn: 所以我可以说我一直把你视为一个好朋友。

segments.en: I've always seen you as a leader.
segments.cn: 我一直把你视为一个领导者。

segments.en: Okay so our last phrase is also the last thing we heard in the dialogue.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们最后的短语也是我们在对话中听到的最后一句话。

segments.en: He said are you willing to give me a shot?
segments.cn: 他说你愿意给我一个机会吗？

segments.en: Are you willing to give me a shot?
segments.cn: 你愿意给我一个机会吗？

segments.en: To give me a shot.
Give me a shot.
Alright I think we have some more examples of how we could use give me a shot in different situations so let's listen.
segments.cn: 好吧，我想我们还有一些例子可以展示如何在不同情况下使用给我一个机会，所以让我们听听。

segments.en: Example one.
I know I can do this drawing better just give me a shot.
segments.cn: 我知道我可以画得更好，给我一个机会。

segments.en: Example two.
The HR manager wasn't going to hire me but he decided to give me a shot.
segments.cn: 人力资源经理本来不打算雇我，但他决定给我一个机会。

segments.en: Okay so when you give someone a shot you take a chance right?
segments.cn: 好吧，所以当你给某人一个机会时，你是在冒险，对吗？

segments.en: Give that person or give an opportunity.
segments.cn: 给那个人一个机会或提供一个机会。

segments.en: Mm-hmm.
Alright so we don't know if she will give him a shot or not but why don't we listen to the dialogue once more to hear these phrases in action.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以我们不知道她是否会给他一个机会，但为什么不再听一次对话，听听这些短语的实际运用。

segments.en: Hey you're early.
Where's everyone?
Well I told them not to come.
segments.cn: 好吧，我告诉他们不要来。

segments.en: I made a reservation just for the two of us.
segments.cn: 我只为我们两个人预定了座位。

segments.en: I thought we could have a quiet evening all to ourselves.
segments.cn: 我想我们可以有一个安静的晚上，只有我们自己。

segments.en: Oh why?
Jennifer there's something I want to ask you.
segments.cn: 珍妮弗，我有件事想问你。

segments.en: Sure what is it?
Hmm okay here's the question.
I can't take it anymore.
I know you better than anyone.
I know the pros and cons of your personality.
segments.cn: 我知道你性格的优缺点。

segments.en: I even know what side of the bed is yours.
segments.cn: 我甚至知道你床的哪一边是你的。

segments.en: I think we would be great together don't you?
segments.cn: 我觉得我们会很合适，你觉得呢？

segments.en: Are you serious?
We've been friends for years.
segments.cn: 我们已经是多年的朋友了。

segments.en: We can't just change that overnight.
segments.cn: 我们不能就这样一夜之间改变。

segments.en: I know I never had the guts to tell you until today.
segments.cn: 我知道我从来没有勇气告诉你，直到今天。

segments.en: So what do you say?
Are you willing to give me a shot?
segments.cn: 你愿意给我一个机会吗？

segments.en: All right so an interesting dialogue and it opens up a cultural point.
segments.cn: 好吧，这是一个有趣的对话，并且引出了一个文化点。

segments.en: That's right.
So in the dialogue the guy was asking her if she would be his girlfriend right?
segments.cn: 所以在对话中，这个家伙在问她是否愿意做他的女朋友，对吗？

segments.en: Right but I guess it's not very common among adults at least in English-speaking countries.
segments.cn: 对，但我想在成年人中，这在英语国家并不常见。

segments.en: Yeah we don't say like okay so please will you be my boyfriend now?
segments.cn: 是的，我们不会说，好的，请你现在做我的男朋友吗？

segments.en: You know right right right um you would do that maybe in high school.
segments.cn: 你知道的，对对对，嗯，你可能在高中会这样做。

segments.en: Yeah but even even then I think it's a little funny um I think for us when we start to have romantic relationships it just sort of happens naturally right?
segments.cn: 是的，但即使那样，我觉得这有点搞笑，嗯，我觉得对于我们来说，当我们开始有浪漫关系时，这种事情就自然而然发生了，对吧？

segments.en: You never really have this conversation will you be my boyfriend?
segments.cn: 你从来不会真正进行这样的对话，你会做我的男朋友吗？

segments.en: Right I guess afterwards you just start talking about other things which you just consider that you guys are already boyfriend and girlfriend.
segments.cn: 对，我想之后你们只是开始谈论其他事情，你们就认为自己已经是男朋友和女朋友了。

segments.en: Yeah there's no real there's no official starting point.
segments.cn: 是的，没有真正的，没有官方的起点。

segments.en: Yeah there's no official point that says okay now we are boyfriend and girlfriend.
segments.cn: 是的，没有官方的时刻说，好吧，现在我们是男朋友和女朋友。

segments.en: Yep.
Which is interesting because in other countries they do go through the formality of asking somebody to become their boyfriend.
segments.cn: 这很有趣，因为在其他国家，他们确实会经过正式的询问某人是否愿意成为他们的男朋友。

segments.en: Yeah but even um you know like 20 or 30 years ago in English-speaking countries you would do this.
segments.cn: 是的，但即使是，嗯，你知道，20或30年前在英语国家，你也会这样做。

segments.en: Oh yeah of course.
And it was called going steady.
Going steady.
So you would ask will you go steady with me?
segments.cn: 所以你会问，你愿意和我稳定交往吗？

segments.en: That means let's become a stable couple.
segments.cn: 这意味着让我们成为一对稳定的情侣。

segments.en: Exactly.
All right so we want to hear your stories and well how do you do it in your country?
segments.cn: 好吧，我们想听听你的故事，那么在你们国家是怎么做的？

segments.en: Do you ask someone out?
Do you maybe just give them the first kiss and that's an automatic yes?
segments.cn: 你可能只是给他们一个初吻，那就是一个自动的“是”？

segments.en: Well I don't know but I'm looking forward to hearing from our listeners.
segments.cn: 嗯，我不知道，但我期待听到我们的听众的反馈。

segments.en: So guys check out our website EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 所以大家请查看我们的网站 EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: You can leave your questions and comments there.
segments.cn: 你可以在那儿留下你的问题和评论。

segments.en: All right we'll see you guys there and until next time.
Goodbye.
Bye.
